title: MV Target
text:
MV "Target" is a <a href="Semi-submersible%23Heavy-lift">semi-submersible heavy</a> transport ship, built by <a href="Brodosplit">Brodosplit</a> in <a href="Yugoslavia">Yugoslavia</a>.
History.
Built in 1990 as a <a href="tanker%20%28ship%29">tanker</a>, MV "Jahre Target", MV "Target" is the second of six single hull tankers to be converted into heavy lift vessels. After completing submerging and sea trials, the former <a href="sealift">sealift</a> vessel was delivered to the new owners, <a href="Dockwise">Dockwise</a> on 24 December 2007.
Design.
MV "Target" was converted at the <a href="COSCO">COSCO</a> shipyard in <a href="Nantong">Nantong</a>, China. A new midsection was fitted to the bow and aft sections of the single-hull tanker. She has a carrying capacity in excess of 35,000 tons and an unobstructed deck area measuring 44.5 m x 130 m.
Service.
MV "Target" is designed to transport complex, high-value cargo, including semi-submersible and jack-up drilling units, as well as offshore structures. She is managed by <a href="Anglo-Eastern%20Group">Anglo-Eastern Ship Management</a> who provide technical and crew management. 
In 2009, MV "Target" transported the <a href="Royal%20Navy">Royal Navy</a> ice-strengthened survey ship, from the <a href="Falkland%20Islands">Falkland Islands</a> to <a href="Portsmouth">Portsmouth</a>.
